name: Sr Data Engineer
description:
The Global Data Engineering unit is committed to take the company to the next level of IoT Data Products, by executing the implementation of Next Generation Data Platform, Real-Time Analytics and BI Visuals, as well as effectively feed AI algorithms by the Data Science team. Towards such a goal, the Global Data Engineering team is responsible of building the Data Infrastructure, Data Structures/Repositories and Data Pipelines to support the whole company and market data needs.

The main responsibilities are:

Translate requirements to Data pipeline components
Research globally for data acquisition entities & stakeholders to succeed in the Data ingestion implementation
Collaborate on definition of roadmaps, tools, priorities, risks, constraints and status for each project
Establish Unit Testing programs for developed Data pipeline components
Lead and be part of the implementation execution of designed data pipeline components
Collaboration with different teams, in order to establish data ingestion methods, but also the methods to interface with Data outputs, to be developed by Software team.
Should be able to publish and deploy ETL pipelines and repositories for data & ML engineering into all environments.
Follow up and support company‚Äôs data pipelines, bringing visibility of the whole responsibilities, through agile (SCRUM) methodology.

name: Project Manager
description:
The Enterprise Solutions Specialist will provide direct support to U.S. based businesses and indirectly to global business units. With almost all of the company‚Äôs back-office solutions there will be a continuous need for innovative, high quality solutions that can and transform how the business operates. 

The main activities are:

‚Ä¢	Full responsibility for the U.S. based CRM and ERP platforms and all related applications 
‚Ä¢	Develop and execute a comprehensive strategy for the development and support of the company's CRM and ERP platforms.
‚Ä¢	Translate business requirements into functional specifications to ensure that business systems meet the needs of the business.
‚Ä¢	Supervise and lead the Business Systems team, providing guidance, support and professional development.
‚Ä¢	Collaborate with business leaders and business units to understand specific needs and challenges, and provide effective and efficient technology solutions.
‚Ä¢	Identify opportunities for improvement and optimization in existing business processes.
‚Ä¢	Ensure the integrity, confidentiality and availability of business data through appropriate security controls and policies. Security controls, compliance (SOX), and audit support.
‚Ä¢	Enforce development life-cycle management including specification, development, testing, deployment, and documentation.
‚Ä¢	Implement package solutions on an enterprise level including internationally (e.g., ORACLE NetSuite)
‚Ä¢	Interact with and manage service providers and contractors.

name: Sales Research Intern [3-month internship]
description:
Our search begins for a Legendary Sales Research Associate to support our sales team as we bring our platform to teachers and students across the world! 
We are looking for someone withentry-level knowledge of Salesforce, Outreach and/or Mode. If you don't have any experience, don't worry, we can teach you.
The most important thing we are looking for is someone with great attitude, drive, persistence; and that can thrive in a fast-paced startup environment. 

This is a 100% remote position. You are expected to work 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday during 3 months, with the opportunity of being hired for a full-time job offer at the end of the internship.

Duties and Responsabilities:
- Send regular usage reports to points of contact for school-level opportunities.
- Process individual teacher licenses in Salesforce.
- Generate quotes for inbound sales inquiries for school-level and individual teacher opportunities.
- Prospecting and data entry tasks in Salesforce, such as converting leads to contacts, adding new contacts, and general data upkeep.
- Manage outbound Outreach sequences and funnel to sales reps, when appropriate.
- Export data from Mode and alert field reps of potential opportunities based on usage trends.
- Other tasks identified to support sales and company-wide initiatives.

*The position's salary is listed in MXN, but the pay is in USD ($500-$1500)

name: Data Engineer
description:
Data Engineer

We are looking for a ‚ÄúData Engineer‚Äù with experience with crafting ETL processes to source and link data in preparation for Model/Algorithm development. This includes domain expertise of data sets in the environment, third-party data evaluations, data quality. You will do things like build data pipelines, maintain data pipelines: set and maintain reoccurring schedules that run pipeline code, automate and implement DS models. 

Common requirements:

Data Engineer working in creating batch and real-time data systems. 
Hands-on experience with big data technologies like Hive, Spark, Hadoop. 
Recent accomplishments working with the tech stack: Cloud Dataflow, Dataproc, Big Query, SQL, Hive, Kafka, Cloud storage, Data Fusion, Sqoop, NoSQL 
Self-starter, strong technical skills, quality oriented and passionate 
Familiar with performance tuning SQL and ETL pipelines 
Proven skills with either Java or Python programming language 
Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
